result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley A. Shafer

records.addlTxt: 10:02 AM cases 22CF377, 22CF917 called. Defendant Bradley A. Shafer not in court.  Attorney Zebulon Patek on behalf of Katherine Cook in court for Bradley A. Shafer.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. State requests a warrant- so ordered.

10:31 AM Defendant Bradley A. Shafer not in court.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Bradley A. Shafer.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has 22CF917 set in court on 09/22/22 at 9:30am in Br. 6. This case will be rescheduled to match.
Arraignment scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(11:22 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Bradley A. Shafer appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Bradley A. Shafer.
Court orders the warrant is quashed and bond continues.
Court and State advise if the defendant has any future non-appearances, State will be asking for a cash bond.
Attorney Cook to schedule an Arraignment with Branch 4 Judicial Assistant.

10:19 AM Prosecuting attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bradley A. Shafer not in court.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Bradley A. Shafer. This is the date and time set for an Argn. Warrant ordered.

(2:54 PM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Bradley A. Shafer in court. Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Bradley A. Shafer. 
Parties advise are ready to proceed.
State calls Deputy Ricky Hagen of the Eau Claire County Sheriff's Department, who is sworn and testifies.
Attorney Cook conducts cross-examination of Deputy Hagen. Witness excused.
State moves for bind over. Attorney Cook advises may make argument regarding jurisdiction, but now is not the time.
Court finds probable cause and binds the case over.
Arraignment scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 9:30 am in intake court.
